first_reading.text:
[[Qo 1,2]]Vanity of vanities, says Qoheleth, vanity of vanities! All things are vanity!
[[Qo 1,3]]What profit has man from all the labor which he toils at under the sun?
[[Qo 1,4]]One generation passes and another comes, but the world forever stays.
[[Qo 1,5]]The sun rises and the sun goes down; then it presses on to the place where it rises.
[[Qo 1,6]]Blowing now toward the south, then toward the north, the wind turns again and again, resuming its rounds.
[[Qo 1,7]]All rivers go to the sea, yet never does the sea become full. To the place where they go, the rivers keep on going.
[[Qo 1,8]]All speech is labored; there is nothing man can say. The eye is not satisfied with seeing nor is the ear filled with hearing.
[[Qo 1,9]]What has been, that will be; what has been done, that will be done. Nothing is new under the sun.
[[Qo 1,10]]Even the thing of which we say, "See, this is new!" has already existed in the ages that preceded us.
[[Qo 1,11]]There is no remembrance of the men of old; nor of those to come will there be any remembrance among those who come after them.
first_reading.title: Book of Ecclesiastes

psalm.text:
[[Ps 90,3]]You turn man back to dust, 
saying, "Return, O children of men."
[[Ps 90,4]]For a thousand years in your sight 
are as yesterday, now that it is past, 
or as a watch of the night.

[[Ps 90,5]]You make an end of them in their sleep; 
the next morning they are like the changing grass,
[[Ps 90,6]]Which at dawn springs up anew, 
but by evening wilts and fades.

[[Ps 90,12]]Teach us to number our days aright, 
that we may gain wisdom of heart.
[[Ps 90,13]]Return, O LORD! How long? 
Have pity on your servants!

[[Ps 90,14]]Fill us at daybreak with your kindness, 
that we may shout for joy and gladness all our days.
[[Ps 90,17b]]Prosper the work of our hands for us!
[[Ps 90,17c]]Prosper the work of our hands!
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
